scenes.location: EAST WILMINGTON HIGH SCHOOL LOCKER ROOM
characters: J.T. SEXXY, CORPORAL PUNISHMENT, CHRIS COLUMBO...
N A 20TH ANNIVERSARY REMATCH OF THEIR LEGENDERY EPIC
YOU EARNED IT DUDE... YOUR A WARRIOR
DDIE RUCKUS, THE MORTICIAN, DEAN "THE DREAM" GIGUNDA,
PS... IF YOUR UP BY THE 23RD, I GOT SOMETHING IN YONKERS
IVAN PETROV, THE SANDBAGGERS, BILLY BOB BANJO,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over OPENING CREDITS, a montage of OLD WRESTLING-MAGAZINE PHOTOS. Action shots of RANDY "THE RAM" ROBINSON taking o keffiyeh-wearing heel named THE AYATOLLAH before 20,000 screaming fans at Madison Square Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of a SCREAMING, CHEERING CROWD overwhelm us. O the images, RINGSIDE ANNOUNCERS boom commentary:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Oh, my! Ram hit with a devastating piledriver!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"I've never seen a guy get fired into a buckle that h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"The Ayatollah taking it to The Ram outside the ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Ram absorbing tremendous punishment! How much more c take?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Wait a minute... Look at this... The Ram is getting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"He's coming back! I don't believe it!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Suplex!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Powerbomb!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Randy The Ram Robinson giving absolutely everything got! This is the very definition of heart!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Just listen to this crowd! The entire Garden, 20,000 people, are on their feet!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Ram climbing to the top rope... The crowd going wild They know what's coming..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHOTO of Randy standing on the top rope, his bent arms pressed against the sides of his head like RAM'S HORNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Uh-oh, the horns are out... Here it comes..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FREEZE on a final image of Randy FLYING HIGH ABOVE THE CANVAS, horns out, poised to crash down on The Ayatollah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ----"Ram Jam! Lights out!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over this, the sound of the crowd GOING CRAZY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Def Leppard song rings out as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present day. Post-match. Randy, pushing 50, still with th same long, dyed-blond mane, sits on a bench in the boys locker room of a Wilmington, Delaware high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls off his purple spandex wrestling tights. Lime-gr ram's horns run up the sides. They're the same kind of ti as in the `80s pics----and may well be the actual same pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked except for a jockstrap, Randy takes a breath. Achy, sweaty, saggy, exhausted. A battered warrior. Scars all o his body. Despite the rough shape he's in, it's clear he' just given it his all in the ring. He swigs down a few pi with a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promoter SCOTT BRUMBERG, a heavyset man in a Mets jersey BRUMBERG - 44 on the back, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great show, Ram. Ya turned it out. (a little sad) As always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Randy some cash. Randy counts it. It's not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I was sure the gate'd be bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy just shrugs resignedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, changed into his street clothes, limps out of the school, each step labored and painful. Waiting near the entrance are TWO FANS, both men in their 30s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Ram. Think you could...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fan #1 holds out a SHARPIE and an old WRESTLING PROGRAM f the `80s. On the cover is a shot of Randy wrestling CORPO PUNISHMENT, a heel in a drill instructor get-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy takes the program, happy to oblige.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hands back the program. FAN #2 hands him a MINI-POS The faded, mid-'80s poster features Randy, biceps bulging crushing a head of broccoli between his fists. Across the top, it says "EAT YOUR VEGETABLES, PUNK!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Randy signs) My first match ever was you versus Davey Diamond at the Spectrum. (NOSTALGIC) 1985...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy smiles a little. He remembers, too. He hands back t poster. Fan #2 looks fondly at Randy, a part of his boyho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vaguely sad) You were awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods, a bit uncomfortably. The two fans, muttering thanks, drift off into the Delaware night. Randy is left standing alone, still holding Fan #1's pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to a beat-up old CONVERSION VAN and climbs Turns on the engine. Music starts up on the stereo mid-so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is driving. On the dashboard is an old ACTION FIGUR HIMSELF from his WWF days. On the stereo, a different son plays, later in the same album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls into the entrance gate of PARADISE OAKS TRAIL PARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy parks in front of his TRAILER. He gets out and head toward it. A dismayed look comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: The door is PADLOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tugs on the lock. Tugs on the door. No dice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He violently kicks the padlock in a moment of rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy resignedly climbs into the BACK OF HIS VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on a scrunched-up mattress on the floor, unabl sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van wall is decorated with a MINI-SHRINE Randy has bu to himself. Old magazine and newspaper clippings, mini- posters, etc. A few changes of clothes lie in a messy hea the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a bottle of pills and pops a few, washing them d with a beer. He closes his eyes, trying to unwind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is asleep in his clothes from the night before. He' STIRRED AWAKE by the sound of kids YELLING and BANGING on outside of van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly sits upright, massaging his pain-wracked knees. Every inch of him feels like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raaam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: Through the front windshield, TWO 8-YEAR-OLD KIDS, boosted by TWO OTHER KIDS, are peering in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is playfully tussling with the four kids. He picks of them up and "bodyslams" him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (announcer voice) Oh, my... look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up another one and fake-drops him on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suplex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams a third one. The kids are squealing with delight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tombstone piledriver!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sees a car drive up and park by the MANAGER'S OFFIC He watches it with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch you maniacs later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids moan with disappointment as Randy heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy glares at Len, the trailer park's MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Len. Don't be such a fuckin' ballbreaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get in when I get my rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm good for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. You're good for it every time this happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sigh-groans in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I at least park in back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Len looks at Randy. A wave of pity comes over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits on a MILK CRATE by his parked van. On the grou in front of him is a BLENDER connected to an extension co stretching to another TRAILER. He pours a protein-shake packet into the blender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer door opens. A WOMAN comes out. Lighting a cigarette, she looks up at the cloudless, starry sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Meg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Randy a small "You got it" wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters a suburban Shop-Rite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sticks his head in a door marked MANAGER'S OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting behind a desk is store manager WAYNE (40). He loo up at Randy, irked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we not know how to knock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne casually clicks a porn site closed on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy steps out and closes the door behind him. He knocks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Randy! What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy groans privately. He really hates Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any extra shifts you could throw my way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, they raise the price of tights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is not amused. Wayne grabs a LOOSELEAF BINDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne starts flipping through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much anything weekday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, working alongside some MEXICAN GUYS, lifts a STACK BOXES off the back of a BOAR'S HEAD DELIVERY TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carries the boxes through a RUBBER-STRIP CURTAIN, into WALK-IN COOLER. He puts them down and heads back out agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands with GREGG, a huge bodybuilder who's countin off some bills. Randy growls with displeasure at the smal liquid-filled GLASS BOTTLE in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON bottle: The label says SUSTANON 250. The rest of label is in SPANISH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' ya, bro, it's identical to the German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried Mexican sus once. Gave me bitch tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years ago, right? Mexican's way better now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bro, it's the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy steps in front of Gregg's locker and starts ROOTING AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy finds a bottle with GERMAN WRITING on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my own stash. That's my last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy puts the bottle of Mexican sustanon in the locker a walks off with the German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danke schoen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, underwear pulled down, plunges a needle into his a cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is BENCHPRESSING. He grunts loudly as he squeezes o one more rep, his SPOTTER urging him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push it out----you got this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strip-mall tanning salon. Randy breezes in, nodding hel to the FRONT-DESK WOMAN, who's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin', Glor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cupping phone) Hey, babe. Four's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON an upright tanning pod. INSIDE THE POD, Randy is standing naked, baking under the UV lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. LOOKING GOOD HAIR & NAILS - SHORT TIME LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in a chair as a KOREAN LADY wearing latex glov BLEACHES HIS ROOTS. His hair is full of plastic clips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave it in too long. All those pieces broke off last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is driving along Route 21. "Once Bitten Twice Shy" blasting on the stereo. One hand on the wheel, he bangs o the song's piano riff on the dash with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes Cheetah's, a STRIP CLUB. He keeps an eye on it he drives past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song fades out. He pops the tape out of the deck and tosses it on the passenger seat. On it is a messy pile of cassettes. Skid Row. MГ¶tley CrГјe. AC/DC. Guns `N' Roses sifts through the selection, one eye on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is still driving. AC/DC's "Back In Black" cranks lo He pulls into the parking lot of a VFW HALL and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift locker room/staging area. Randy and 20 or so other WRESTLERS stand before the event's sleazy, tracksui clad promoter, NICK VOLPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up, only saying it once. Vic Storm, you're up first against D- Day. Second, Shawn McPride and Funkmaster Garry B. Slick. Third, Frankie Cirillo and Rob Dynamo versus J.T. Anvil and The Ultimate Freak. Fourth, Teddy Brewski and Lex Lethal. Intermission. Fifth, Samoan Savages versus the Disco Brothers. Sixth, the Irish Warrior and Vyper. Seventh, "Sandman" Steve Sambuca versus Hollywood. Last but not least, for the strap, Kid Loco versus Randy The Ram. Got it? Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volpe walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits alone a table toward the back. He takes a roll athletic tape out of his supplies-filled WHEELIE TRAVEL B He starts WRAPPING HIS KNEES AND ANKLES. He does it in a slow, methodical manner. It feels almost ritualistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is hashing out the match with his opponent, a wiry Puerto Rican kid whose shiny vinyl pants identify him as LOCO (22).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there, you post me. Hard. I show color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid Loco nods, listening closely, deferential to the lege

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You post me again. Again. (Kid Loco nods) You're fuckin' whalin' on my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy turns and sees fellow wrestler LEX LETHAL sticking head into the cafeteria door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some chick out here looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SHRUGS) Some chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ring rat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy emerges from the cafeteria. A look of PLEASED SURPR comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, kiddo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: Standing there in an otherwise empty hallway a plain-ish YOUNG WOMAN (22). She looks at him with an unsmiling expression. This is STEPHANIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls her in for a hug. She doesn't really hug back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back, breaking off the hug. A brief, awkward pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doing here? Here to root on your old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay----as long as you're not rooting against me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is irked by his jokiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there someplace we can talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on in a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't take much of your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie gathers herself. This isn't easy for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to make amends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to talk to people I've hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is puzzled for a moment. Then, it clicks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh... 12-stepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'm sure you mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smile-nods insincerely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For anything I've done or said over the years. All the anger at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the last time I saw you... I'm sorry for what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive wave) Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie is irked by his lack of engagement. She looks a him with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you even know what I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was about your mom. And me. (vague, flailing) Like, how I was bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raa-am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy turns and sees TWO MEATHEAD FANS down the hall, hea his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whassup, yo? Randy The Ram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEATHEAD #1 gives Randy an excited high-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gonna see some action tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sly grin) Tonight's forecast calls for severe butt-whoopin's with a 100 percent chance of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psyched "Yeah!"s from the meatheads. Stephanie is pissed the interruption. And, even more, Randy's embrace of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we get a picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problemo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two meatheads flank Randy, their arms around his broa shoulders. Meathead #1 looks tentatively at Stephanie, holding up his DIGITAL CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you could...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She coldly takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problemo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks into the camera. The meatheads stick their tong out and throw up devil signs. Randy flexes theatrically, making his best "Aaargh!" wrestling face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie snaps a shot. Meathead #1 takes back his camera and his buddy pat Randy heartily on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, yo. Kick some ass out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it, broski!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meatheads excitedly head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy turns his attention back to Stephanie, who's glarin him with cold disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same old shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hafta. It's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the middle of saying something important and you drop it for the fucking wrestling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask them to come over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like I'm 10 all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we almost done with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ATTACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him calmly. Sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy SMASHING KID LOCO IN THE FACE with a flying drop-ki Kid Loco falls to the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy struts around the ring, exhorting the crowd, soakin their cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distracted, Randy doesn't notice Kid Loco peeling himself the mat. Kid Loco sneaks up behind Randy and SMASHES HIM THE HEAD. Randy goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid Loco lifts Randy up. They're both on their knees, che to-chest. Kid Loco steps to his feet, lifting Randy with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid Loco tightens around Randy's arms, arches his back, presses out his chest and... WHAM!! He and Randy fly with LATERAL DROP. Randy's head hits the canvas hard as he sla down on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Randy writhes on the mat, Kid Loco HEADS FOR THE TURNBUCKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: Kid Loco is untying the turnbuckle's padded cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, clutching his back, discretely reaches into the waistband of his tights and pulls out a RAZOR BLADE. He t the blade between two fingers in his cupped palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid Loco heads back to Randy. He picks up him by the hair drags him to the turnbuckle, throwing him HEAD-FIRST into exposed metal post beneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, clutching his smashed head, discretely runs the bl along his hairline. No one sees it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD STREAMS DOWN Randy's forehead. The crowd's ELECTRIF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid Loco slams Randy's head into the metal post again. Ag Randy slumps over the corner ropes. Kid Loco cockily stru around the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this loser! How pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Randy. The taunting stirs something in him. A lo comes over him, like he's Bruce Banner about to become th Hulk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid Loco saunters back over to Randy. He grabs his head f another post smash, but HE CAN'T. Randy's neck and arm muscles bulge. His neck veins pop like he's suddenly supe charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of FEAR comes over Kid Loco. He knows the tide is about to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy reaches over his shoulder and grabs Kid Loco by the hair. He pulls him in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath) Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy juts his hips back and bends over, gaining the leve he needs for a throw. Kid Loco shakes his head, begging n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy straightens his legs, raises his lower back, and ya down on Kid Loco's head. Kid Loco's feet fly off the canv as his head gets BURIED INTO THE MAT. He gets stuck UPSID DOWN with his feet over the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, holding onto the top rope with both hands, thrusts knee into Kid Loco's stomach. Again. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid Loco somehow manages to untangle himself from the rop He scurries away. Randy goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hits Kid Loco with everything he's got. Dropkicks. Elbows. Bodyslams. He pours it on, unstoppable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy drags Kid Loco into the middle of the ring. He look out at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: A trio of fans are chanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy cups his hand to his ear. The chant quickly spreads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAM JAM! RAM JAM! RAM JAM!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy "mulls" it over. He looks at his laid-out foe. He l at the corner. He heads for the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy climbs to the top rope. He looks around at the crow like he's still undecided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: The fans are cheering, wild with anticipatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy bends his arms, pressing them against the side of h head like ram's horns. (Just like in the photo in the ope montage.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LEAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leap is not terribly high or graceful. He crashes dow onto Kid Loco horns-first. Kid Loco's whole body convulse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fans lose it. This is what they wanted. The Ram Jam. money shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, on a post-match high, sits on a cafeteria table enjoying a beer as a pseudo-MEDIC stitches up his hairlin gash. Nick Volpe wanders over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram, man, you popped that crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy smiles contentedly. He sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Ram. Got a sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Volpe comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, needledick? Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize what's coming up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks at him, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May 6th...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy racks his brains. He has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20th anniversary of you and Ayatollah at the Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AMAZED) Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Time fuckin' flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sees an excited smile creep across Volpe's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha thinkin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words: Re. Match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is instantly intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing a big Fanfest thing down in South Carolina that weekend. I wanna main-event it with you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram-Ayatollah II. 20th anniversary. Hundreds, thousands of screaming fans watching you two make history for the second time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think Bob'd get back in there? He's pretty retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this? (cool, confident nod) I bet he'd be willing to dust off the old turban.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's mouth is practically watering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spring in his hobbled step, Randy gets out of the van a heads toward Cheetah's, the strip club he passed earlier. Manning the door is BIG CHRIS, a huge bouncer/doorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whassup, Ram? How ya been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Big Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They chummily shake hands. Big Chris pulls Randy in tight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into Randy's ear) Hey, can you get me any more of that IGF-1?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I look like, some fuckin' two-bit street dealer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, hook a brother up. You get the family discount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing by the mansion. Any day this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You da man, Ram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: BIRDMAN & LIL WAYNE - "STUNTIN' LIKE MY DADDY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded, not-very-glamorous Jersey strip club. Randy st over by the bar. The female BARTENDER slides him a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy takes a swig, looking around the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's VIP-in'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, nodding, takes his beer and heads over toward the STAGE. He settles in at an open table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG STRIPPER (22) works the pole, grinding lewdly to "Stuntin' Like My Daddy", a bass-heavy Dirty South rap so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, watching her, quickly grows bored. He finds the stripper, like the song, crude and soulless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is at the urinal. He flushes and heads over to the sink. He washes his hands, checking his look in the mirro He primps a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy exits the bathroom and heads back toward the table. route, he passes a curtained-off VIP ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, babe. You're gonna be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, hearing this, slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We said the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The redhead. With the belly chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy peeks through the curtain. Inside, he sees CASSIDY (36), a sexy, tattooed, aging rocker chick in a white spa dress. With her are six hair-gelled, goombah-wannabe BACH PARTY DUDES (early 20s). The BACHELOR is sitting in a cha in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys, she's on break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry, but we don't want you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're, like, my mom's age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stifled laughter from his buddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's anger builds as he watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, trying to salvage the gig, straddles the bachelo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing like experience. (into his ear, seductive) I've done things your little fiancee's never dreamed of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like graduate in 1985.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cracks his friends up. Randy BURSTS THROUGH THE CURT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dude #2) Apologize to this lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is taken aback, including Cassidy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak to her with respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy wedges herself between Randy and Dude #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not okay. This is definitely not okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the bachelor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guarantee this woman's 50 times hotter than whatever goombah skank you're about to marry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dude #1) You hear what he just called Gina?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my fuckin' sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude #1 steps to Randy, chest puffed out. Randy whips aro and GRABS THE CHAIR OUT FROM UNDER THE BACHELOR. He wield menacingly at Dude #1, who backpedals, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy makes like he's going to hit the guy with the chair Instead, he FLINGS IT AT THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUDE #2                         DUDE #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!!                         What the FUCK!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire bachelor party rushes for the curtain. Just li that, they're GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks at Cassidy, expecting a hearty thank you. Ins he gets a PISSED-OFF SHOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot. That was 200 bucks just walked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is totally taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ask for help? (BEAT) Did I need help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks down, silent and sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't fuckin' help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I'm sorry. (BEAT) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy calms down a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him with a warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see ya, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is getting a LAPDANCE from Cassidy. She plants her hands against the mirrored wall behind him, her body just inches from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking one of the historic matches in history. 20,000 people. Another million and a half watching at home on pay-per-view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, giving him a nice view of her writhing behind. the small of her back is an AC/DC TATTOO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were going back and forth, just killin' each other for a half hour. Any wrestling fan, they know all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Million and a half? Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was big. So a rematch... (smiles, contemplating the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: History all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy turns around again. Randy looks her body up and d savoring her curves as she dances just for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you are smokin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy smiles a little. This makes her feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My Neck My Back" ENDS. Cassidy pulls back on her dress a casually sits down next to him. A new song comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look toward the stage, where a PUERTO RICAN STRIPPER shakes her ass to the staccato, abrasive Latin rap song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows. I put on a good show...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy nods supportively, sincerely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be the thing that gets me back on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know who's in that crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARMED LOOK comes over Cassidy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy follows her eyes to his HAIRLINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small amount of BLOOD is trickling down from his stitch He grabs a COCKTAIL NAPKIN and casually dabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got cut tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, it's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (small chuckle) And they say wrestling's fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy proudly holds out his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this for fake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIDY'S POV: A long-ish SCAR on Randy's bicep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1986. Denver Coliseum. Billy Bob Banjo hit me with his two-by-four. Loose nail tore the bicep open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls down his shirt collar, revealing a nasty COLLARB SCAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1988. Orlando Arena. Mr. Magnificent tossed me out of the ring. Landed on my shoulder, clavicle snapped in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BLISSFUL) Not when they're going crazy for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy stands up and straddles him, gazing soulfully at scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He was pierced for our transgressions, He was crushed for our iniquities. The punishment that brought us peace was upon Him, and by His wounds we were healed."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy contemplates the quote. He likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from "Passion of the Christ". (BEAT) You never seen it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy shrugs no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you gotta. It's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down next to him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, like, so inspiring. They throw everything at Him. Whips, arrows, rocks... Just beat the living fuck out of Him for the whole two hours. And He just takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. I'll have to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy lightly traces a finger along Randy's bicep scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sacrificial Ram...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pitbull song ends. A new song begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, please welcome to the Cheetah's stage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the lovely Cassidy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy reaches into a pocket and pulls out some bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I owe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gimme for three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy peels off three $20s and hands them to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll wait `til I'm done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy just smiles. She gives him a small peck on the chee and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy BURSTS ONTO THE STAGE. She owns it with rock `n' energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Randy's face as he enjoys the dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is driving over the Throgs Neck Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls up to a TWO-FAMILY HOUSE in working-class Queens. Out steps Lex Lethal (from the Passaic VFW show).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy heads down a highway entrance ramp, Lex Lethal ridi shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the lift, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No prob. You're right on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy merges into traffic on the Long Island Expressway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how big's this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Two, two-fifty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been there. The Ricky Whipsaw memorial benefit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should get a good gate. DiFusco says he's gotten like 20 calls last two days alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy chuckles cynically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless hardcore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Long Island strip-mall 99-CENT STORE. Randy and Lex bro an aisle. Randy is holding a TIN CAKE PAN. He bangs it against his forehead, testing it out. It makes a LOUD CLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lex takes the pan, testing it against his own head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cookie trays were better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lex spots something exciting on another shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a pack of STEEL-WOOL PADS. Randy nods in approva Lex tosses them into the SHOPPING BASKET Randy is holding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON basket. It's full of all sorts of "supplies": co trays, lightbulbs, thumbtacks, cheese graters, wire hange cutlery sets, pizza cutters, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if they got extension cords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head off in search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands BEHIND A CURTAIN as his entrance song plays. sneaks a peek through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: A ROWDY CROWD of about 150 fills a COMMUNITY CENTER GYM. The vibe of the crowd is a bit rougher than previous events. A banner on the wall reads ECHW - EAST C HARDCORE WRESTLING. Pressed against the outside of the ri are a FOLDING TABLE and a 12-FOOT METAL LADDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANNOUNCER stands with a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands quiet and peaceful, head lowered slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Elizabeth, New Jersey, weighing in at 218 pounds... The former WWF superstar and wrestling legend... The one, the only...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy "The Ram" Robinnnnsonnnnn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy explodes into the gym, full of fire and showmanship

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does a lap around the outside of the ring. His hand is raised high in the air, index finger and pinky curled int set of RAM'S HORNS. Fans do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids rush toward Randy, reaching out for HIGH FIVES. He obliges as many as he possibly can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fans hold out FOLDING CHAIRS in front of him. (Just like the opening montage.) He "rams" each one with his forehea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want blood, You got it!/ If you want blood, You got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does a lap around the perimeter of the ring, enthusiastically head-butting chairs the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood on the streets, Blood on the rocks/ Blood in the gutter, Every last drop/ If you want blood, you got it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy climbs into the ring. He does a few neck rolls and bends, limbering up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song fades down. A new song rises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugly, plodding HARDCORE DEATH METAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his opponent: From Hampton, Virginia, weighing in at 295 pounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boos begin to rain down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibaaaal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the curtain, HELLBILLY CANNIBAL emerges. A huge, overalls-clad, mangy, wild-eyed masochist. Crumbs cling t his scraggly beard. He's dragging a heavy CANVAS SACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEENAGER in the crowd holds up a sign reading HELLBILLY CANNIBAL SUCKS A FAT DICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal climbs into the ring with his sack and folding chair. He heads to the center of the ring, where Randy awaits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit down on chairs facing each other. Under Hellbill Cannibal's chair is his canvas sack. Under Randy's is his Dollar Tree plastic shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal punches Randy. Randy punches Hellbilly Cannibal. They take turns punching each other, each shot little harder than the last. It's like a violent game of "slaps".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a stretch of this, Hellbilly Cannibal reaches into sack and pulls out a can of BUG SPRAY. He SPRAYS it in Randy's face. Randy falls off his chair. He staggers arou the ring clutching his face, howling in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal smashes the blinded Randy over the hea with his chair. Randy falls to his knees. Hellbilly Canni reaches into his sack and pulls out a FLUORESCENT LIGHT T Wielding it like a bat, he SMACKS RANDY in the face. The explodes with a pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing a folding chair, Hellbilly Cannibal charges towa Randy. He takes a flying leap, riding the chair like a bo board. Just as he's about to crash down on Randy, Randy R OUT OF THE WAY. Hellbilly Cannibal's spine gets a violent jolt as the chair hits the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy reaches into his Dollar Tree bag and pulls out an aluminum COOKIE TRAY. He smacks Hellbilly Cannibal in the face with it. The tray makes an awesomely loud METALLIC CLANG. Randy hits him a bunch more times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is starting to get winded. His heart beats faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up Hellbilly Cannibal and flings him toward the ropes. Hellbilly Cannibal, bouncing off, ducks Randy's awaiting forearm. He bounces off the opposite ropes and crashes into Randy knee-first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal grabs Randy by the hair and smashes hi face into the corner post. He scoops him up and FLIPS HIM OVER THE TOP ROPE, out of the ring. Randy LANDS HARD on t concrete floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal hops out of the ring with the folding chair. He WHALES RANDY IN THE FACE with it. Randy stumble backwards toward the metal barricade between the ring and fans. Hellbilly Cannibal kicks him in the chest. Randy fl over the barricade, into the crowd. Fans scatter in an exhilarated panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal throws Randy into a row of empty chair Randy goes sprawling. Chairs fly everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gets up. His heart is beating LOUD. FAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, dazed, heads toward the SNACK-BAR AREA. Hellbilly Cannibal follows after him. Randy grabs a metal GARBAGE C and WHIPS AROUND WITH IT, smacking Hellbilly Cannibal squ in the face. Hellbilly Cannibal goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy shakes out the can's contents over Hellbilly Cannib showering him in trash. He shoves Hellbilly Cannibal's he into the can and falls on it, ass-first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy grabs the ladder resting along the base of the ring POUNDS THE GARBAGE CAN with it, making an UNHOLY RACKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the can still over his head, Hellbilly Cannibal rise his feet. He HEADBUTTS RANDY with the can. Randy, stumbli around, gets headbutted again. Hellbilly Cannibal throws the can and drags Randy back to the ring by his hair, carrying the ladder in his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plopping Randy down on the mat, Hellbilly Cannibal sets u the ladder in the middle of the ring. He heads back out a grabs the folding table, setting it up by the ladder. He reaches into Randy's Dollar Tree bag and pulls out a BOX THUMBTACKS. He scatters the tacks all over the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal grabs Randy and pulls him up the ladde with him. They stand at the top, perched high above the table. Just as Hellbilly Cannibal is about to push off, R surprises him with a VICIOUS HEAD-BUTT. Hellbilly Canniba caught totally off guard. Randy headbutts him again. Rand grabs Hellbilly Cannibal and PUSHES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In mid-air, Randy does a 180 twist, causing Hellbilly Cannibal to CRASH THROUGH THE TABLE with Randy on top of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal rolls around the mat in a daze, his ba bloodied and covered with tacks. He staggers to his feet. Randy hits him with a dropkick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's heartbeat is DEAFENING. All other sounds drop out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls Hellbilly Cannibal off the mat. As he gears u for another dropkick, his KNEES BUCKLE. A look comes over face. He DROPS TO HIS KNEES, one hand on the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy grabs his arm. He massages it. He FLOPS OVER, clutc his chest. He lies on his back gasping for breath, suckin the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: The fans are unaware anything is wrong. They assume it's part of the act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellbilly Cannibal sees a look of FEAR in Randy's eyes. H knows this is real. He looks out at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few fans look around. Most of them still think this is a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among those who sense it's real is JERRY DIFUSCO, the eve promoter. He climbs into the ring. Kneels over Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is gasping. DiFusco turns to Hellbilly Cannibal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lex Lethal and some of the other wrestlers climb into the ring. They huddle around Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no small effort, they lift Randy. They carry him to ropes. They slow, unsure how best to get him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lower him to the mat. Lex hops out of the ring and g Randy's ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the other guys hop out of the ring, supporting Randy's underside as they carefully, awkwardly pull him o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, the crowd realizes this is real. They surge forwa as DiFusco and the wrestlers carry Randy toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back, get back, get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is carried down a LONG HALLWAY, trailed by curious concerned fans. Lex is closest to Randy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay, buddy. Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a door and enter. The wrestler holding Randy's feet shuts it behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on a table, his eyes rolling back in his head. squeezes his hand, trying to keep him conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with us, bro. Help's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMS WORKERS come rushing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies unconscious. There's a BREATHING TUBE in his m and ANOTHER TUBE going through his CHEST WALL. He's hooke to a MECHANICAL VENTILATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies asleep. The breathing tube is out. The chest t is still in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes slowly open. He looks around, disoriented. Woozy Confused by all the wires on him, he starts PULLING THING OFF. Monitors BEEP. Nurses rush into the room, calming hi down as they try to reattach the wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He faints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, transferred to a regular hospital room, is watchin "All My Children" on the wall-mounted TV. The chest tube out, in its place a large bandage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight Indian accent) Mr. Ramovic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up. DR. TARACHANDANI (40) enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor, nodding, looks down Randy's folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how we lookin', doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot better than before the bypass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. So I'm all good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the doctor's face, it's not quite that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your heart... You're going to have to start taking much better care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters, you must take your medication every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could handle that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No smoking. (Randy nods) And no cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive, offended) I don't do coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over your blood work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish, busted) Maybe once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it has to be never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gives him a reluctant nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for exercise, it's still okay, as long as it's moderate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, like, wrestling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I do it moderate? I could hold back on certain moves. There's always ways to fake----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ramovic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (edgy glare) Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, a man with your heart should not be flying around a ring crashing into people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's nostrils flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Dr... (reads name tag,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Trachanani, I'd like a second opinion on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. But I promise you, any doctor I showed your file would say the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lets out a skeptical, sarcastic snort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost died. The next time, you won't be so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a second opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your heart's been through a lot. Even before the heart attack, it was significantly----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a second opinion. (BEAT) I WANT A SECOND OPINION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is checking out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADMISSIONS-DESK WOMAN hands him some paperwork. He fo it up and stuffs it in a pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was left for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a plain white ENVELOPE. Randy opens it. Ins is a NOTE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks into the envelope again and pulls out $300.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the money, chuckling ironically. It's his big payday in years. He tucks it in a pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have somebody picking you up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy steps out of the hospital into the bright light of He squints, his eyes adjusting. He stands there looking around, a lost animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAB pulls up to Randy's van, still parked in the commun center's lot. Randy steps out of the cab and limps to the van. He gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in the van in the otherwise empty lot, ponderi his next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy roams an aisle, killing time, idly browsing the selection of deodorants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin Ramovic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up. He heads down the aisle, toward the voice comes to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female PHARMACIST stands holding a small pharmacy bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robin Ramovic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy heads toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a small, embarrassed nod, taking the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hands Len the manager a bunch of cash. Len notices seems a little off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Len removes the padlock from Randy's trailer door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A messy, junk-filled trailer. Randy stands at the kitchen counter with the CVS bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the bag and takes out FOUR PRESCRIPTION PILL BOTTLES. We catch a glimpse of the drug names on them: PLAVIX. COREG. LIPITOR, LISINOPRIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes at the patient name on all of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is taking a shower. On his chest is a SURGERY BANDA He soaps up, careful not to get the bandage wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy collapses on the bed, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on the bed, gazing off. Restless. Bored. Somet catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: On the floor, in front of the TV, is an old NINTENDO VIDEOGAME SYSTEM. The game cartridge in the cons is WRESTLEJAM `88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sticks his head out of his trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: In front of the opposite trailer, ADAM (8), of the kids he was play-wrestling with, is idly throwing tennis ball against a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Adam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam turns and looks toward Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna play Nintendo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Adam sit on the floor playing WrestleJam `88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyber-Randy is wrestling The Ayatollah at a packed Madiso Square Garden. The graphics are late-'80s crude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy flies all over the ring, devastating his foe with a series of acrobatic leaps and kicks and flips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy wears a look of intense concentration. Adam makes a scrunched-up face at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that square?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What square?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're hitting me with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a folding chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a chair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PISSY) Yes, it's a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy grunts, annoyed. They play for a stretch in silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1988 ain't old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was, like, 50 years before I was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outside trailer) Ad-aam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks toward the window. Randy hits PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam turns back to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam nods yeah. Randy un-pauses. Play resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyber-Randy drops The Ayatollah with a knee to the chest. another. The Ayatollah GOES DOWN. Randy heads to a corner CLIMBS TO THE TOP ROPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his arms, sticking his elbows out, pressing his fists to the sides of his head to form a SET OF RAM'S HOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy JUMPS. He flies high in the air, soaring over the m and crashing down on The Ayatollah horns-first. He pins T Ayatollah as the ref counts to three for the victory. The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy does a little celebratory fist pump. He hits RESET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you wanna get even? I whipped your butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam gets up and scampers out of the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, suddenly alone, looks at the TV. He gazes at the w on the screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 PLAYER        2 PLAYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He selects 1 PLAYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new match begins. Randy plays without much enthusiasm. After a few halfhearted kicks and punches, he TOSSES THE CONTROLLER ASIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, standing in the middle of the trailer, does a JUMP JACK. He does another. A few more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels himself getting winded. A little woozy. He sits down. He sits still, trying to slow his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry, bitter, frightened tears roll down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters the club. It's crowded tonight. He looks aro for Cassidy. He spots her in a corner offering a CUSTOMER lapdance. The customer passes. She moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy heads over. She gives him a friendly little cheek p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetie. You're back soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I was just in the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy nods oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("CASUAL") Hey, feel like maybe grabbing a burger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy finds the offer a little odd. This isn't how they operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout later, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, puzzled. He seems off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk for a sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someplace more quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy glances toward the door. Cassidy, catching his drif looks at him, a little gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, I can't leave with a customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed to talk to somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't talk here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a couple minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, I don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy looks at him, torn. She sees the need, the fear i his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you parked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another pause of hesitation from Cassidy. This is big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to your car. I'll meet you out there in 15 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in the van, staring at the club's rear EMERGEN EXIT. Cassidy emerges, a jacket covering her dress. Randy waves. Spotting him, she comes over, climbing in the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at his vulnerable expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That's fucked up, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Feelin' much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was while I was wrestling. I collapsed in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. That's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was pretty fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chuckles, a little perversely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell ya, though, it was a big hit with the fans. (amused grin) Promoter told me everybody was hanging around wondering if I was okay, they wound up buying up all of his T-shirts and shit. Whole merch table got cleaned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's grin fades. His expression turns melancholy, fear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor says I can't wrestle no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know what to do. If I can't wrestle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loses himself in some bleak thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just happened. You don't have to figure everything out this second. Give yourself some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's all I got. I just sit there all day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares off bleakly again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really shouldn't be alone right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her, looking her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little unnerved) Randy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him with sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel bad what happened. But you and me... I can't go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gives her a sour, disappointed look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be with family now. You have a daughter, right? Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't really get along too good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. You need her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter chuckle) She don't need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody needs a father. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy shrugs, not so sure. Cassidy glances at the dashboa clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I gotta get back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts a sympathetic hand on his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a peck on the cheek. He lingers there for a second. A weird, tentative moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods, putting his brave face back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Randy The Ram. I've taken bigger bumps than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll give my daughter a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck not? I'm her father. A person only gets one father in this life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you're adopted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy laughs. She gives him a friendly pat on the shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy climbs out of the van. Randy watches as she heads back into the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cheery expression fades. He is alone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits on his bed, sifting through a messy, junk-fill shoebox. He pulls out an OLD PHOTO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: It's a mid-'80s photo of Randy and his infan daughter Stephanie in front of the family Christmas tree. Randy, wearing a Santa cap, is smiling and laughing, Stephanie perched on his huge, steroid-pumped bicep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips the photo over. On the back are a bunch of scrib PHONE NUMBERS. They're all crossed-out except the last on The numbers get progressively more faded from bottom to t as if they've been written down over the course of years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands at a PAY PHONE with the photo, ringing phone cradled to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Stephanie, you know what to do. (answering machine BEEP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy listens to the silence. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in his van by the curb of a modest, lower-midd class house. He looks at the house, working up the nerve approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands at the doorstep of the house. Steeling himse he rings the bell. A WOMAN (22) appears at the door in a SHIRT and PANTIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little thrown) Hey... Is Stephanie home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks at Randy a little coldly, sensing who he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can I say it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappears into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few moments later, Stephanie emerges with a BACKPACK sl over her shoulder. In her hands is a TEXTBOOK. She heads straight down the driveway, blowing past Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches up. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's really not a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She resumes walking, briskly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! (chasing after her) Where ya going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the textbook in her hands: PRINCIPLES OF CHIL DEVELOPMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in school? That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns DOWN THE SIDEWALK. He continues following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middlesex County Community.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middlesex? That's kind of a hike. Where's your car? (no response) You taking the bus? Lemme give you a lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. I'm parked right by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie picks up the pace, trying to lose him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're walking pretty fast there. You running late? (no answer) I could help you with that. (no answer) Give you a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps right on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Jersey Transit sucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buses smell like piss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fights off an amused smile. She slows a tiny bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is driving Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left at the second stop sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy drives. He slows at the second stop sign, which is bigger, FOUR-LANE STREET. He makes the left. They drive f stretch in awkward silence. Randy seems a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause as Randy gathers his words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I wanted to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a heart attack. (BEAT) Last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her earnestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna try to fix things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie sits there in calm silence, processing all of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you wanna fix things. Now that suddenly you're all scared and alone from your heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. It's not like----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so fuckin' you. You only come around when you need something from somebody, when they can do something for you. Selfish fuck. Good. Be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly OPENS HER DOOR as the van is moving. She HOP OUT. Randy hits the brakes, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie stumbles and falls. She gets up. Walks off in t direction they came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone. He angrily punches the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on his bed, gazing off depressedly. On his che is a well-worn DAY PLANNER, open to a marked-up page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON page. Scribbled in marker in one of the boxes is RAHWAY AUTOGRAF SHOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, standing at a folding table in a gym, unzips a duf bag. He pulls out a stack of 8x10 GLOSSIES of himself. It high-flying, mid-air Ram Jam photo from the height of his '80s glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts them on the table. Looks around the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: He's at an AUTOGRAPH SHOW that hasn't starte yet. Around the perimeter of the gym, TEN FOLDING TABLES set up. At each one, a BEAT-UP, WORN-OUT OLD WRESTLER is laying out his wares----8x10s, old match tapes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think I'd see you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up and sees Scott Brumberg, the promoter from beginning. He's wearing the same "BRUMBERG - 44" Mets jer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
