dialogues.text: Heard you collapsed at the DiFusco show. Sounded pretty scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy smiles coyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sold the shit outta that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta give credit. DiFusco came up with the idea. We're setting up an angle for a grudge match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... Dude, you are good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gives a proud "Hey, what can I say?" shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sure I'd have to cancel the minivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What minivan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one I rented for Fanfest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and a whole gang's driving down. Terry C., Caggiano, Fatback... I am so fuckin' psyched. (BEAT) You see the flyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks at him blankly. Brumberg walks over to a near table, where there's a stack of BRIGHT-ORANGE FLYERS. (Th same flyer can be seen scattered around the room on chair the floor, etc.) He grabs one and brings it back over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volpe gave me an assload to pass out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands it to Brumberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is gonna be epic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: The flyer.

dialogues.speaker: N A 20TH ANNIVERSARY REMATCH OF THEIR LEGENDERY EPIC
dialogues.text: MAY 6, 1988 WRESTLESLAM IV MATCH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY "THE RAM" ROBINSON VS. THE AYATOLLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods vaguely at the flyer, his feelings hard to rea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumberg looks around the room as the wrestlers set up sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should get a pretty good crowd today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy holds up his hand, wiggling his fingers for Brumber

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll start loosening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumberg walks off. Randy looks at the flyer again. A sou expression comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signing is underway. FIVE OR SO FANS mill about the r drifting from table to table getting autographs and takin photos with the motley assortment of washed-up aging wrestlers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is sitting behind his table, signing one of his 8x1 for a FAN. He hands it to the guy, who hands Randy a $5 b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, broski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fan walks off. Randy tucks the fiver into the FANNY P he's wearing. There's not much in there, just a meager fe ones and fives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy zips up the fanny pack. He looks up, ready to sign autographs----just as soon as somebody comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits at his table, bored. There are NO TAKERS. He l around the room at the other wrestlers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: One is asleep. Another looks borderline homeless. Across from him is a 40-SOMETHING WRESTLER in a WHEELCHAIR. Attached to his calf is a URINE BAG. A feeble stream of urine trickles into the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks down at the stack of Randy The Ram 8x10s on t table. He gazes numbly at the high-flying image of himsel from 20 years earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up and sees Brumberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sure the turnout'd be bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy shrugs resignedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls up to his trailer. He sits there with the eng idling, staring at his trailer, scared to go in alone. He pulls back out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, roaming the room, approaches a CUSTOMER sitting the stafe. She leans in to his ear, her hand on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a lapdance, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy moves along. She approaches a PAIR OF GUYS. She l in to one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a lapdance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks toward the other guy. Before she can even ask:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy heads off, rejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and sees Randy. She's happy to see him after th string of no's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How ya feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him over to a table. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go with your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (UNCONVINCING) Good. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy dodges her eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too good, actually. She tore me a new asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods dispiritedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tough. You can't give up. You gotta keep trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another half-hearted nod. A brief conversational lull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about maybe getting her a present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great idea! (BEAT) What's she into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of music does she like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she into books? Cooking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy just looks at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you not know? She's your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a shitty fuckin' father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, feeling bad, is hit with an urge to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's 22? Okay... (RIFFING) You should get her some clothes, some kinda clothes... All girls like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the perfect place. This kick- ass little vintage shop in Westfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday's the best time to go. That's when they get the new stuff in, all these boxes full of great shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll write it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy grabs a pen and a cocktail napkin off the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure it's on 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scribbles down YESTERDAZE - WESTFIELD. Hands it to hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good tip. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy starts dancing for him, as is their routine. Rand doesn't seem into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna grab a drink at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gets up and heads off toward the bar. She watches h go, feeling rejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy gets up. CAMERA stays on her face as she does a l around the club. She glances back toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIDY'S POV: Randy is sitting at bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans the room. A CUSTOMER is looking her way. She st to approach. Then, she STOPS. She looks back toward Randy again. He's sitting at the bar alone. She heads over to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up from his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy pauses, hesitant. She takes the plunge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout I meet you there Saturday? Help you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("CASUAL") I'm actually gonna be running around right in that area anyway, so it's not really a pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a chummy arm tap and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy knocks on Wayne's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne looks up at Randy, mildly annoyed by the disruption his computer screen is an ONLINE POKER game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wayne. Got a sec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you had something more steady. Full-time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only thing I got right now's got weekends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that when you sit on other dudes' faces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deli counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy seems a little hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, like, working with customers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All day long, hot horny housewives begging for your meat. (BEAT) And prepared salads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the only thing you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the moment. You interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands alone in front of YESTERDAZE, a strip-mall vintage clothing store. He looks at his watch, almost thinking of leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up. He seems slightly thrown by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: It's his first time seeing Cassidy in street clothes and in daylight. She's not wearing makeup, and he hair is pulled back in a ponytail. She's also a good thre inches shorter out of her stripper heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands, a bit awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost didn't recognize you. You look all... clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Clean"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like classy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, nah, I don't mean that bad. I like it. (BEAT) It's like in "Grease", where she turns into the hot rock `n' roll chick at the end. Except backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-kaay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks at her sneakers, a far cry from the clear hee he's used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh... Should I call you Cassidy or Pam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives the question genuine thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam. (playful finger wag) But don't get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy follows Cassidy toward the back of the store. He lo around, taking in the array of funky `50s/'60s/'70s cloth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is awesome... (rubs hands together,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are gonna find something great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is less loose and playful than Randy, much more i business mode. They come to the back where, against the w she finds what she's looking for: a bunch of CARDBOARD BO bursting with a wildly eclectic assortment of tops, skirt pants, etc. She starts sifting through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know her size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's kinda skinny, a little shorter than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy spots a fun, multi-color MINI-SKIRT. She pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you see her in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. (BEAT) Not really. (BEAT) I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy tosses it back in. She unearths a Flashdance-styl SWEATSHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy makes a sour face. She tosses it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So like, what is she? Goth? Punk? Hippie? (BEAT) Preppy? Stoner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy ponders the choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy lets out a good-natured groan of frustration. Ran watches as she continues searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Pam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy looks at him. She can feel his sincere appreciati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She returns to searching. Sift, sift, sift, sift...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she might be a lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy stops sifting. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy leads Randy by the arm over to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy heads to a RACK OF CLOTHES. She quickly zeroes in a RETRO BOWLING SHIRT. She holds it up to Randy, who make scrunched-up face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, maybe she's just a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy puts the bowling shirt back. As she does, somethi catches Randy's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? (POINTING) The green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy holds up the item for Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SURPRISED) This?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited look comes over Randy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: A satin-green ROLLER-DISCO JACKET. Embroider on the left breast is a big "S" in purple script. It's UG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy looks at the jacket. She clearly finds it awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Randy, who's beaming with excitement and pri She finds it very endearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterdaze bag in hand, Randy opens the door to his van. and tosses the bag inside. He's on a post-shop high, miss accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never woulda known about this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll give you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tentative pause. Cassidy looks at him, ready to part wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I worked up a pretty good thirst in there. What say we grab a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One beer! We gotta re-hydrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy seems torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really can't. (BEAT) I got a kid at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy nods. Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy shrugs casually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy or girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy. Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... I had no friggin' idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not something I usually tell customers. Not exactly a turn-on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks off at something by his van. An idea hits him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unlocks the door. Leaning into the van, he TEARS THE R THE RAM ACTION FIGURE OFF THE DASHBOARD. He proudly, excitedly holds it out to Cassidy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now both our kids got something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the action figure, reluctant to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna turn this down, too? Man, you're rough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy chuckles a little. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very nice of you. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to take good care of that. $300 bucks on eBay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy laughs a little. She can't help but be charmed by sweetness and earnestness. After a pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Cassidy are having beers at the bar. He's holdi her CELLPHONE, looking at PICTURES of her son. He moves o the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a good-lookin' kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see where he gets it from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy smiles, flattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure doesn't get it from his douchebag father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy skips to the next pic. It's a shot of an UNDER- CONSTRUCTION CONDO BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this condo thing, down by Trenton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You moving there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working on it. (BEAT) It's a great area. Way cheaper. And the schools are awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Cheetah's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done. I'm quitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little disappointed) Oh. (nods to self) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's ears perk up at the song on the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up, reaching out for Cassidy's hand. She doesn' give it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a dance place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? Fuckin' Def Lep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CHUCKLES) I've danced to this plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Then I'm dancing for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy starts DANCING in front of Cassidy, who's sitting o barstool. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a lapdance I'm getting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy goes into lapdance mode, "seductively" writhing for her, silly and self-aware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sit back and enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around, wiggling his ass a little for her. He ru his hands up and down her sides. He drapes his long blond mane over her shoulders, running it over her face. She laughs, charmed and amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes into her eyes intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lapdancer has become the lapdanced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy laughs. He continues dancing, totally unembarrass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can get you a shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy bobs his head along to the kick-ass Def Leppard tun really loving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song builds to its chorus. Randy SINGS ALONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a bottle, shake it up/ Break the bubble, break it u-up... (CHORUS) Pour some sugar on me! In the name of love!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, unable to resist the call of the Lep, joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pour some sugar on me! C'mon fire me up! (pointing at each other) Pour your sugar on me! I can't get enough... (eye contact, sultry) I'm hot, sticky sweet/ From my head to my feet yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here, the song veers off into a GUITAR PART. Randy n along, savoring the awesome hair-metal riffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't make `em like they used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' eighties, man. Best shit ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Def Lep, Gunners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CrГјe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that Cobain pussy had to come around and ruin it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like there's something wrong with having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' mopey douchebag. (BEAT) "Ooh, look at me! I wear flannel! I'm all depressed!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm from Seattle! I like rain!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy shakes his head sourly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineties fuckin' sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their EYES MEET. A moment of CHEMISTRY. Mutual attraction

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy moves closer, his eyes locked on hers. He leans in for... a KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They MAKE OUT for a few seconds. Cassidy PULLS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Randy a playfully scolding FINGER WAG, masking fear and discomfort with what just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No contact with the customers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. My bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps right on dancing, totally unaware of the shift t just occurred in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at watch) I totally didn't realize the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up. Randy is very disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. You said one beer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy points toward her ALMOST-FULL BEER on the bar. She picks it up and CHUGS the whole thing. She slaps the empt bottle on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him an arm pat and walks out of the bar. Randy impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Randy's first day of work. He slips into a DELI COAT Tucks his hair into a hairnet. Pulls a Shop-Rite baseball over the hairnet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to a mirror to see how he looks in his new uniform. He feels a little silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here ya go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and sees Wayne, who hands him something. Randy l at the item in his hand, vaguely bothered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was gonna say Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON item, a Shop-Rite NAME TAG. The name on it is RO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess they got it off your W-4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I really even need to wear one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC) Are you gonna be interacting with our valued Shop-Rite customers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could they maybe re-do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wear the fucking thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne walks off. Randy pins the name tag to his apron. He takes another look in the mirror, sighing unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up at the employee-room clock. It's 8:59 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads toward a RUBBER-STRIP CURTAIN leading to the del counter. Standing before the curtain, he pauses a moment, gathering himself like before a wrestling match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps through. Showtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 10 CUSTOMERS hover in front of the deli counter wit Take-A-Number tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, manning the counter, hands an OLD GUY in a WWII VETERAN baseball cap a packet of roast beef. The guy shuf off. Randy looks up at the Take-A-Number sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN (60s) steps forward holding a 17 and a SHOP-RITE CIRCULAR. She carefully surveys the TURKEY-BREAST SELECTI in the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hudson Acres, are they all on sale or just the regular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks clueless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up circular) It's a little unclear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands the circular to Randy to take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: It says HUDSON ACRES TURKEY BREAST - $5.99/L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer the maple-glazed, but if it's full price...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy briefly catches eyes with another customer, a BIG- HAIRED, SEMI-HOT PARTY CHICK in her forties. The kind of woman Randy would hit on in a bar. He dodges her eye cont embarrassed by the context.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to circular lady) Hang on, let me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy picks up a phone behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, over

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, please come to the deli counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cringes a bit as his voice booms over the store speake He hangs up and returns to the customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just be a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman, nodding, looks into the deli case again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which in your opinion is the best smoked ham?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it depends what you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried the Apple Valley Farms once, and it was very salty. Do you find that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy steals a self-conscious glance at the party chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Take-A-Number sign. It says NOW SERVING: 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN (35) in workout clothes steps forward with a 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I get a half-pound of the pesto pasta salad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy grabs a plastic container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pesto change-o.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman smiles at Randy's little offhand pasta pun. Thi pleases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy scoops pesto pasta salad into the container. He put the container onto the scale. It reads .51 LB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I am good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets Randy a small chuckle from the woman. Randy sla price tag on the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have yourself a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly smile) I will. You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman heads off. Randy's spirits are lifted by the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up at the Take-A-Number sign: NOW SERVING: 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOUSEWIFE-TYPE steps forward with the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The housewife smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's my prize?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything in the case, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pound of chopped liver and a half a pound of egg salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that can be arranged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a plastic container and throws it in the air, catching it behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie emerges from the Middlesex County Community Col building. A look of surprise comes over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHANIE'S POV: Randy is standing there waiting for her his van. Under his arm is a LUMPILY WRAPPED PRESENT, no b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, stalking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do stalkers bring presents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I ain't a stalker. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He excitedly hands her the present. She looks at it waril

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens it. Inside is the green satin jacket. She holds up, trying to process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "S" is for "Stephanie".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the jacket. It's nothing she would ever wear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it just for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see that. What's it for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason. Just because. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. It's... shiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Randy. He is excited and proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking in this store and saw it, and I just said, "That is it."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie nods, smiling politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any time? I was thinking we could swing by our old favorite spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an old favorite spot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll remember when you see. Whaddaya say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's not the best time. I've got some things to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't got stuff! (BEAT) C'mon, give an old man a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He giver her his biggest, most charming puppy-dog smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Stephanie walk along the boardwalk. It's a char little Jersey-shore boardwalk/beach lined with Skee-Ball games, ice-cream parlors, T-shirt shops etc. It's a bit c and not very crowded, still out of season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you were pretty young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk for a stretch in silence. He points to a spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There used to be this funhouse. (BEAT) The Monster Motel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy chuckles at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had this cheesy-ass skeleton that popped out of a coffin. You'd get so scared, you'd cry. Then you'd beg to go in again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles to self) Always was a glutton for punishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd hop on my foot and wrap your arms around my leg. I'd have to walk you the whole way through like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I totally don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her sweetly) I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Stephanie sit on a bench facing the ocean eatin mint-chocolate chip ice-cream cones. Randy is quiet and contemplative, not in his usual "on" mode. He takes a dee breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I accept your apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoots him an irked look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like that. I just mean... You made amends. I free you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her expression softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you've ever done or said or thought, I forgive. You've done nothing wrong to me. And anything I've ever done... (BEAT) I'm sorry. Truly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie is surprised by his emotion and sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was young. My career was booming. All those lights, the fans, the crazy shit on the road... I wasn't thinking about my kid. Or my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My priorities were all fucked up. I know that. But now... I wanna try to make things right. I wanna try to get to know you. (lump in throat) I just hope it's not too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gazes off at the ocean, filled with fear and love a regret. A tear starts to gather in his eye. He wipes it a before it has a chance to form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie looks at him, moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Stephanie play Skee-Ball side-by-side, father a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands with Stephanie in front of her house, droppi her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope that wasn't too painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, unsure what to do, extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake. He pulls her in for a brief, mechanical hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... How about dinner sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Tuesday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, "casual") Or not. That's cool, whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wednesday would work better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is surprised and happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sticks the old Christmas photo of Stephanie and him on the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands at the pay phone, ringing phone to his ear. his hands is his day planner, open to a page marked up wi upcoming gigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Miggy. Ram. How ya doin'? (BEAT) Good, good. (BEAT) Listen, you're gonna have to count me out for Utica. (momentous pause) I'm retiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how ya doin', Frank? (BEAT) Good, good. Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another call. Randy is holding the Fanfest flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Volp. You know I'd kill to do it. (BEAT) I realize. I understand. (BEAT) No more. I'm done. I'm retired. (BEAT) Positive. It's time to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is up on stage, doing her thing for a sizable cro She slinks up to a customer who's holding out a dollar bi for her. She pulls on her G-string band, snapping it shut the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves over to another customer holding out a dollar a does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks toward the voice, coming from another side of t stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIDY'S POV: Standing there is Randy, holding out a PUR ENVELOPE. He looks toward her G-string, like he wants to it in like a dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it with her hand instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Cassidy sit together at a table. Cassidy is hol the purple envelope, looking a little uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it later when it's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, Cassidy opens it. Inside is a GREETING CARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIDY'S POV: On the card's front, a cartoon monkey is holding a big bunch of bananas. Across the top, it says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy watches excitedly as she reads the inside. She puts it down after reading it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very sweet. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I couldn't've done it without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I could help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was fun, right? We had a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods politely, reservedly, clearly trying to pull bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FISHING) Shopping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another guarded nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you ever been to Mother Kelly's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On 46?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got this kick-ass cover band Tuesday nights. Play anything you can think of. What do you say we----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("you and me" gesture) This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is confused and disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had a little something going here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're awesome. You're a great guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm, like, this stripper, but I'm not. I'm a mom, with responsibilities. I don't think you wanna get with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the other day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club and the real world, they can't mix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we'd met someplace else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if we did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say I don't know you, but you won't let me get to know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a customer. You're just a fucking customer. That's it. Okay? Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, wounded pause from Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (BEAT) I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a $20 out of his pocket, holding it out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lapdance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides it across the bar to her. She slides it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're refusing a customer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides the $20 back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a lapdance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides it back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Am I a customer or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves the $20 tauntingly in her face. She pushes it aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? (no answer) Not in the mood? (no answer) So fake it. I'm just a stupid customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tauntingly dangles the $20 in front of her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks away, trying to ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, give the customer a lapdance. Shake your tits. Smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretend you like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a lapdance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SWATS HIS HAND. The $20 falls to the floor. He picks up and SLAMS IT on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I WANT A LAPDANCE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People turn and stare. Randy storms out of the club, humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 10 CUSTOMERS hover in front of the DELI COUNTER clutching Take-A-Number tickets. Randy, manning the count with a COWORKER, hands a WOMAN a packet of roast beef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help who's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD LADY steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pound of German potato salad, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy grabs a container and starts scooping potato salad. puts the container on the scale. It reads 1.06 LB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy scoops out a little and weighs it again. The scale reads .96 LB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy puts a little more in. The scale reads 1.03.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, trying to contain his aggravation, takes a tiny bi out. The scale reads 1.00. The lady nods in approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy slaps a price sticker on the container and hands it across the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuffles off with her potato salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help who's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUE-COLLAR GUY (40s) steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, could I get a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy does a DOUBLE-TAKE, noticing Randy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you from somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy studies Randy's face, trying hard to place it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so damn familiar. (racking his brain) You Teamsters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. What can I getcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half pound of Virginia ham and a half pound of the Jarlsberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy reaches into the case and pulls out a ham. He bring over to the slicer, his back turned away from the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we've met someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slice, slice, slice, slice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play softball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slice, slice, slice, slice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not one of Mikey Bosch's buddies, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, shaking his head no, brings the sliced ham over to weigh scale. The guy SNAPS HIS FINGERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Randy, surprised and amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy The Ram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands there frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old wrestler. From the '80s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, shrugging blankly, wraps up the ham and slaps a pr sticker on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forms Ram horns) Ram Jam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy grabs the Jarlsberg from the case and brings it ove the slicer. He starts slicing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that's freaky. You look just like the dude. Except older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON the block of cheese as Randy slices. There's onl SMALL CHUNK left. The chunk dwindles, getting smaller and smaller. The cheese separating Randy's fingers from the b grows thin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He almost seems tempted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, unable to sleep, sits shirtless on the couch, star blankly at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An NBA HIGHLIGHT CLIP of a FEROCIOUS DUNK. The crowd goes wild. The player roars as he runs back up court, full of macho swagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's eyes drift downward toward his chest. He gazes at still-fresh scar. Touches it tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a big swig of wine, polishing off a bottle. He p a cassette into the BOOMBOX on the floor. GUNS `N' ROSES USE YOUR ILLUSION II.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy cranks up the volume and hits PLAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song begins with the sound of a ROARING STADIUM CROWD chant begins:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guns! And! Roses!... Guns! And! Roses!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy starts to prowl the floor like it's a wrestling rin before a match. He waves his arms, exhorting the crowd on song as if their cheers are for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cups hand to ear) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy works the crowd. He points at a fan in the back row Flexes theatrically. Bangs his head on pretend chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy grabs the top rope and gives it a hard shake. Loose up with some neck rolls and trunk twists, he heads to the center of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ANNOUNCER-LIKE) Folks, we are ready to rumble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song, which starts with a slow, bluesy guitar intro, kicks in. FAST, RAGING HARD ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stares down his invisible opponent. The opponent SU PUNCHES him. Randy drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on the floor getting kicked and punched. He kn his opponent down with a LEG SWEEP and pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hits his opponent with a flurry of backhand chops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen such determination!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy immobilizes his opponent in some sort of headlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeper claw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy flips his opponent upside down, his head between hi knees. He drops him headfirst onto the bed/mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piledriver! (BEAT) Just listen to this place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy scoops up his opponent again and SLAMS HIM TO THE M with another fancy move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powerbomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song reaches its frenzied, chant-like CHORUS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy joins in, pumping his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strip-mall sports-card/comic-book shop. Tacked to the w by the entrance are FLYERS for various events----card sho autograph signings, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the counter is promoter Scott Brumberg, scarfing d a sloppy Subway sub. The door opens. He looks up, smiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy heads over and gives him a warm hello handclasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Brummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumberg pulls him in for a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's tricks? Good to see ya, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, good, good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what brings ya by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I was thinking about maybe doing a reffing gig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you're retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wrestling, just reffing. Thought it might be fun. Shits `n' giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumberg, nodding, reaches down and grabs out a beat-up SPIRAL NOTEBOOK with old event flyers sticking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what we got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-school cafeteria. Randy is slipping into a REFEREE UNIFORM. Along the wall hangs a vinyl banner reading CAPW CONNECTICUT ALL-PRO WRESTLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy The Ref!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up and sees BOOKER D (30s), a big, black wres in FULL PIMP REGALIA. Though not a pro like Randy, he's u tier indie circuit. Randy gives him a grin and handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Sup, bro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and McPride was going over spots. We got this dope idea how to work you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really ain't lookin' to mix it up tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna love this. Check it out. So McPride----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. You guys do your thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booker D looks at him, surprised and puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booker D lands on opponent SHAWN MCPRIDE with a BIG SUPLE He falls on top of McPride for the pin. Randy The Ref sma the mat, counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One!... Two!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McPride kicks out. Booker D lifts up McPride. He hits him with a CHEST CHOP, sending him stumbling backwards into t ropes. Booker D goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA STAYS ON RANDY'S FACE as he watches them wrestle o screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's eyes are glued to the action... Punches. Kicks. Suplexes. Bodyslams. The crowd is going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is tempted. Salivating almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More punches. More cheers. Bodies crash loudly against th mat. Randy's temptation grows with each shot. He can't re any longer. He...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pushes Booker D out of the way. He's SMASHED IN THE FACE by a McPride-swung folding chair meant for Booker D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy goes down. A TRACE OF A SMILE is visible on his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, Booker D, and McPride are SHOWERING in the open sh area. They're on a post-match high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a screwjob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowd was pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McPride gives Randy a "We're not worthy" bow of respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wags finger, grins) Just reffing, my ass. I knew you'd get in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gives him a "Hey, what can I say?" shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all feel like grabbing a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McPride and Booker D both look toward Randy. He's the one they're interested in hanging with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hotel bar, lively and hopping with a weekend crowd. Ran sits at the bar, holding court with Booker D and McPride. They're all well on their way to being drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time Ruckus fixes the tire, we've had so many Nyquil coladas we don't even realize we missed the damn gig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booker D and McPride CRACK UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear to God. Can't make stuff like that up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, tell McPride shit-pit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit pit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never heard that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McPride looks at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, fuckin' classic. (BEAT) 1990. Nashville Coliseum, Rage In The Cage II. I'm in the locker room shaving when behind me the stall door opens. I turn and there's Chris Columbo on the can taking a dump. He goes, "This is for Petrov", fuckin' wipes his ass, takes the shit-covered toilet paper and rubs it in his armpit. Five minutes later, he's in the ring with Petrov in a headlock, poor Petrov stuck there in CC's pit lookin' like he's gonna puke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McPride and Booker D roar with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy beams proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booker D spots something intriguing by the bar entrance. Randy and McPride follow his gaze there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: TWO WOMEN----late 30s, frosted hair, tight d miniskirts----just walked in the bar. He catches the twos stealing a glance in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ring rats, 12 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and McPride seem to agree with his assessment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrestlers are dancing with the women, MELISSA and ALY on the bar's dance floor. Melissa is sandwiched between Booker D and McPride, shaking her ass for them like a 19- old spring breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa is paired off with Randy, grinding her ass against him. She turns, facing him. Looks at him with a coy smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly runs her hands up Randy's sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother used to have your poster on his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy smiles, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude's got taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa notices something intriguing over Randy's shoulder Randy turns to see what she's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: Standing by the bar is a MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.J. My old coke dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods oh. A slightly weird moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't do that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single-person bathroom. Randy and Alyssa are doing BUMP COKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is FUCKING Alyssa from behind over the bathroom sin Alyssa MOANS LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Gawddd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through door) Could you please fuck someplace else? I gotta piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV:   His eyes slowly open. Staring down at him white stucco   ceiling is a poster of a HUNKY, SHIRTLESS FIREMAN with   a pair of suspenders stretched across his up six pack.   Across the bottom it says FIVE-ALARM FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks around, disoriented. He is NAKED in a strange in a strange bedroom. His clothes lie on the floor next t LARGE GLASS BONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, wearing only a pair of bikini briefs, staggers int the KITCHEN. A ROOMMATE (23) in a Tweety Bird nightshirt pouring herself a bowl of Honey Nut Cheerios. She looks a Randy with a casual "wassup" head-nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alyssa's in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy emerges from Alyssa's building in the previous nigh clothes, squinting at the blinding sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters his trailer, chuckling amusedly. He tosses h keys on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads over to the fridge and grabs a beer. As he close the fridge, his expression changes. A look of DEEP DISMAY comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: The old photo of him and Stephanie on the fr door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy rings the bell. Stephanie's "friend" answers the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him coldly and unnervingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Stephanie home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes into the house, closing the door behind her. Ran stands there awkwardly, unsure what that meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks about knocking but doesn't. He carefully turns knob, leaning into the house. From somewhere inside, he h the MUFFLED SOUND of Stephanie and The Friend talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie and The Friend are arguing in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to go out there. You don't owe him shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why would you even---- (looks up toward front

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said you could come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FRIEND'S/STEPHANIE'S POV: Standing there is Randy, ga guiltily at Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please leave my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so, so sorry. I completely, TOTALLY----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to The Friend) I can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teeth gritted) I can handle this, Jen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Friend, disgusted, grabs her coat and STORMS OFF out front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Stephanie are alone. She glares at him for what feels like a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a fucking asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited in that restaurant two hours. Two fucking hours. Just in case you showed up late. "Maybe he got stuck in traffic. Maybe I got the time wrong"... (BEAT) Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I fucked up. I fucked up bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't fuck up. You are a fuck- up. A walking, living, breathing fuck-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to change. Really. I can't stand when I----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just please shut the fuck up. Because I can't even stand the sound of your voice. (SEETHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about having a drink for the first time in 11 months last night. That's what you do to me. (BEAT) You asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a SMALL POTTED PLANT off the table and THROWS I HIM. It NARROWLY MISSES HIS HEAD, exploding against the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking piece-of-shit asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a CAN OF SODA off the same table and THROWS IT. NAILS HIM IN THE THIGH, exploding open on the floor. Soda sprays everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around, half-crazed, searching for something el to throw. He rushes toward her, wrapping her up in his ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SQUEEZES TIGHTER. She THRASHES AROUND, fighting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET THE FUCK OFF ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrashing violently) I HATE YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCKING HATE YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU DON'T MEAN IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, she STOPS RESISTING. A STRANGE AND UNEXPECTED C washes over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is silent and still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, placidly gazing off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I got so hysterical. There's no reason. I don't hate you. I don't love you. I don't like you. I was stupid to think you could change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. I don't care. I'm done. (BEAT) No more fixing it. It's broke. Permanently. I'm cool with it. It's better that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to ever see you again. I don't wanna see you, I don't want to hear you... (BEAT) Done. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I don't care if you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks toward the front door. Opens it wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy steps out the front door. Stephanie's cellphone rin She looks at the caller ID and picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come home. (BEAT) He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door on him, disappearing inside the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands there alone on his daughter's front step. Un what to do. He starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Take-A-Number sign. It reads NOW SERVING: 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of AGGRAVATED CUSTOMERS stand waiting at the coun A FAT GUY in a motorized cart clutching a 71 throws a fel customer a "Do you believe these morons?" eye roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the counter are Randy and a COWORKER. Randy is put a block of Havarti onto the slicer. He moves lackadaisica distractedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, noticing as he roams past, heads over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's pick it up. Rush hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne gives him TWO QUICK CLAPS and walks off. Randy adju the machine's setting and begins to slice. He isn't movin much faster.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: While we're young...             Any year now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy keeps right on slicing at his unhurried pace. He ge in a nice, meditative groove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slice, slice, slice, slice, slice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches as his thumb inches closer to the spinning bla He stares at his thumb. At the blade. His thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He JAMS HIS THUMB INTO THE BLADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood squirts everywhere. On his coat. On the deli meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stares at the DEEP GASH, watching as blood pulses o in crimson surges. He smiles strangely at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A customer GASPS. A commotion quickly spreads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy turns and sees a shocked Wayne rushing toward him. Wayne takes Randy's arm and tries to lead him into the ba out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conscious of customers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get that patched up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy roughly SHOVES him away. Wayne stumbles backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, turning toward the onlookers, raises his thumb to face. He dramatically smears the BLOOD ACROSS HIS MOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Customers GASP. A woman SHRIEKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy drags the gash across his cheek. He SMEARS A LINE O under each eye like WARPAINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (striking wrestling pose) Let's get it onnn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody call the cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy ROARS at Wayne. Wayne JUMPS BACK, frightened. Randy rumbles out of the deli area LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy dashes down an aisle. He dodges a WOMAN PUSHING A SHOPPING CART, purposely "over-dodging" her so he CRASHES INTO THE SHELVES and sends stuff flying. He dodges ANOTHE SHOPPER, dramatically crashing into the shelves again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy charges past the CASHIERS, out of the supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in the van in the Shop-Rite parking lot. He ga at himself in the rear-view mirror, dried blood caked on face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is on the pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick. Randy The Ram... (BEAT) I wanna do it. (BEAT) Fanfest. (BEAT) I know, but I want back in. (BEAT) So call Bob, get the match back on. (BEAT) Pay me? Don't worry. Just cover my expenses. And pay Bob. Make sure he's there. (BEAT) I don't give a shit. I just wanna wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is digging through a pile of clothes in a closet. H pulls out his WRESTLING TIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, wearing rubber gloves and a towel around his neck, combs PEROXIDE through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is SHAVING HIS CHEST. The hair has grown in since h last wrestled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands in the middle of the trailer in just a pair bikini briefs. In his hands is a product called TAN IN A He gives the can a good shake and starts spraying his bod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy puts a snacks-and-soda-filled plastic bag in the fr of the van. He is surprised to see Cassidy pull up in her car. She gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Chris. Cheetah's bouncer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry if I came off like a bitch. I didn't mean that stuff I said. You're not just a customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy nods. He heads toward his trailer. Cassidy follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it seems retarded, but I gotta keep that line. It's how I've been able to live with myself the last 12 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters the trailer, Cassidy close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a place I'm trying to get to in my life. For me and my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy heads to his wheelie bag, open on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving that world behind. And I can't bring anybody with me who----

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't really care) Good for you. Quitting's hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He zips up his bag. Walks outside toward his van. She follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the Fanfest flyer off the passenger seat and han it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DRIVES OFF. She watches him go, the van kicking up dus its wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at flier. A look of concern comes over her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is driving south on the New Jersey Turnpike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy grabs her purse and car keys off the kitchen tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In bed by 11. Don't let him bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BABYSITTER (15) nods at the instructions. Cassidy hea toward the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, monkey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is struck by what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIDY'S POV: DANIEL (9) is on the floor, playing with t Randy The Ram doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as he makes the Randy doll climb up the couch armrest. The doll takes a FLYING LEAP off the couch, onto STAR WARS FIGURE laid out on the floor below. Daniel make EXPLOSION SOUND as Randy slams down on his foe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy looks at the doll, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is dancing onstage. She has a distracted, faraway look in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She abruptly WALKS OFF mid-song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads toward the dressing room, disappearing through curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy----where ya goin', baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy unlocks her locker. She throws everything in it i a duffel bag. She grabs the MASTER LOCK off the locker do and throws it into the bag, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, wearing her coat, steps through the curtain with bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuts across the empty stage, toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy steps out of the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self) Pam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands at a ROADSIDE PAY PHONE, ringing phone cradl to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Stephanie, you know what to do. (answering machine BEEP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. I promise I won't call you ever again. (BEAT) I'm going back to the ring. You were right about me. Everything you said. Anyway... I just wanted you to know... (BEAT) Your daddy loves you. (BEAT) That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is driving south on the New Jersey Turnpike. She' her cellphone. On the passenger seat is the Fanfest flyer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's waffles in the freezer and some burritos if he wants for lunch. He knows where. (BEAT) I'm not sure what time I'll be headed back yet. I'll keep you posted as I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's van is pulled over on the side of the interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is catching a nap as 18-wheelers barrel past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls into the empty-ish parking lot of the GREENVI CIVIC AUDITORIUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters the locker room with his wheelie bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, nah, business is rockin'. Just opened a third dealership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks down a row of lockers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: A huge, dark-skinned man in khakis and a BOB ZAYID PONTIAC polo is talking to SOME OTHER WRESTLER. Thi THE AYATOLLAH (52).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes two in Columbus, one in Dayton. Next 12 months, I'd say Cincy's not out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not too interested) Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah looks up and sees Randy looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram-A-Lam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy heads over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes Ayatollah's hand) What's up, Bob? (shakes other guy's hand) Yo, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see ya, bro. Didn't think we were gonna do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thursday night, I get a call, "It's on! He's back in!" I'm like "What?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah chortles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get settled in, we should go over things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, the spots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, we can just wing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
