dialogues.text: You don't wanna hash it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah gives him a dismissive, cavalier wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have at least a basic plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this: I'm the heel, you're the face. Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah chuckles. Randy walks off, highly annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to other wrestler) Anyway, if you're ever in Ohio, swing on by. I'll make you a nice deal on a G6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy pulls into a gas station. She rolls down the wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GAS STATION ATTENDANT looks her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where the Civic Auditorium is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The card is underway. Through a wall, we hear the muffled sounds of a MATCH IN PROGRESS: cheers, boos, crashes, etc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, sitting alone on a bench in just his jock strap, t up his legs. His focus and intensity builds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy pulls into the lot. There's a lot more cars than Randy pulled in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building's outer concourse. A handful of fans mill ab at a CONCESSIONS STAND and a SOUVENIR TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, handing a ticket to an USHER, enters the buildin She looks around the concourse, not quite sure where to g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, suited up in his tights, paces the floor, gearing himself up for the match. The only other wrestler in the locker room at the moment is The Ayatollah, doing neck ro nearby. Randy catches his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the wall, ARABIC MUSIC starts to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah grabs a large IRANIAN FLAG leaning against lockers. He heads toward an ENTRANCE CURTAIN, Randy close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through curtain) From the Islamic Republic of Iran, weighing in at 252 pounds... The Tehran Terror, the Beast Of The Middle East... (BEAT) The Ayaaa-tooo-laaaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah steps through the curtain, Iranian flag rai high. He is promptly greeted with LUSTY BOOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is walking around the concourse with a mounting s urgency. She spots a SECURITY GUY in a yellow windbreaker sitting by an UNMARKED DOOR. She heads toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is peering through the narrow gap in the curtain, watching The Ayatollah make his entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint, amidst the boos) Death to America!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, turning, is surprised to see Cassidy standing ther She looks tired and worried and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this. This is dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't the best time to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always say that. Whatever you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could really hurt yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing in there. (turns vaguely sad) Out here's where I get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out here's what counts. The real world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the real world. Nobody gives a shit about me in the real world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit my job, drove 14 hours through the night to get here. What do you call that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks away, unable to hold her gaze. Through the curtain, we hear the Arabic music DIE DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from auditorium) And his opponent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new, familiar song rises on the auditorium speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd roars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to curtain) Listen to them! This is where I'm great. This is where I belong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks at the curtain. He looks at Cassidy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Elizabeth, New Jersey, weighing in at 219 pounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you after the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs him) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from her, toward the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A true wrestling immortal, one of the greatest of all time... (BEAT) Randy "The Ram" Robinnnnsonnnnn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy bursts through the curtain to HUGE CHEERS. There's probably 700 people there in the 2,200-seat facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated at a ringside table are the match's COMMENTATORS, pair of wannabe Marv Alberts in their 20s. A sign taped t the table reads CAROLINA WRESTLING NETWORK. Next to the t is a VIDEOCAMERA on a tripod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is, folks! Randy The Ram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy raises a set of ram's horns high in the air. Fans d the same in tribute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: History about to be made here at the Greenville Civic Auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy takes a long lap around the ring, ramming chair aft chair. His head gets a little bloody. The fans eat it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy climbs into the ring, where The Ayatollah awaits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cheers continue. Loving, appreciative, sustained chee Randy stands there soaking it in, basking in their love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the microphone from the ring announcer. He looks around. A hush comes over the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got one thing to say to you people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks toward Cassidy, standing over by the entrance curtain. He looks out at the larger crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD CHEERS. Randy takes a contemplative pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take your lumps and bruises in this game. But you know what? It's all worth it. Because of you guys. Your cheers keep me young. They make me feel alive. (BEAT) In 1982, the year I wrestled my first professional match, I was six- foot-one. By 1993, I was five-foot- eleven. Three back surgeries in 11 years knocked two full inches off my height. I may be down to five- eleven, but performing in front of you people has always made me feel 10 feet tall. And that's the way it's always gonna be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks toward Cassidy, who's standing over by the entrance curtain. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lowers the mike, finished. The fans CHEER WILDLY, t loudest cheers yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Randy nods appreciatively at the crowd, The Ayatollah SNEAKS UP BEHIND HIM with a folding chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fans shout, trying to warn Randy about the sneak attack, he doesn't hear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah SMASHES HIM OVER THE HEAD. Randy goes down. match is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah picks up Randy and throws him into the rope Randy bounces back toward The Ayatollah, who lazily puts an elbow for Randy to run into. Randy practically has to his face to the elbow. Hitting the mat, Randy pops back u and grabs The Ayatollah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah, phoning it in, throws Randy into the ropes again. This time, The Ayatollah has a raised knee waiting Randy. Randy runs into it, doing his best to sell the sho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath) You're workin' pretty light here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gets up and grabs The Ayatollah's arms. With a nift move, he flips The Ayatollah over his shoulder, SLAMMING HARD into the mat. Randy falls on top of him, pressing Th Ayatollah's face into the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy flips The Ayatollah over onto his back, pinning his shoulder blades. The REF swoops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One!... Two!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah KICKS OUT. They both get up. The Ayatollah toward the ropes. He bounces off. Randy braces for someth good, but all he gets is a feeble CHEST SLAP. Randy grabs Ayatollah and puts him in a headlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime you wanna join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy scoops up The Ayatollah and drops him over his knee with a BACKBREAKER. The Ayatollah grimaces in pain as he the mat. Before he has a chance to get up, Randy hits him with a FLYING ELBOW DROP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah gets up, pissed at the rough treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy goes for a dropkick, but The Ayatollah catches his ankles in midair. He JERKS UPWARD on Randy's legs, sendin Randy CRASHING TO THE MAT on the back of his head. The Ayatollah falls on Randy's throat with his knee. He grind Randy's face into the canvas as Randy did to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is cringing. It's hard for her to watch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah picks up Randy and throws him into the rope Randy bounces back, flinging himself sideways at The Ayatollah. The Ayatollah catches him in mid-air, cradling in his arms. The Ayatollah drops Randy onto his bent knee Randy falls to the canvas, clutching his side. The Ayatol falls on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot how much fun this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ref swoops in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One!... Two!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy KICKS OUT. As Randy "recovers", The Ayatollah jumps of the ring and grabs a folding chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah, climbing back in, props up the chair in a corner. He picks Randy off the mat and flings him at the chair. Randy VAULTS OVER IT, sailing through the ropes an OUT OF THE RING. He hits the concrete floor, CRASHING aga the metal barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy winces. She starts to tear up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah hops out of the ring. He stands over Randy, kicking him repeatedly. He grabs his Iranian flag, waving tauntingly at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAN #1 (O.S.)                      FAN #2 (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camelfucker!                       Fat piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah looks down at Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pathetic. ("spits" on Randy) Pitiful godless infidel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boos rain down on The Ayatollah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah takes the butt end of his flag pole and JAB into Randy's side. Randy grimaces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah unties the flag from its pole and WRAPS IT around Randy's neck. He JERKS UPWARD on the flag, lifting Randy off the mat by his neck. Randy THRASHES AROUND, fighting for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah releases Randy from the choke. Randy crumpl to the ground, gasping for air. The Ayatollah picks up Ra by his hair and flings him back in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah grabs the folding chair from the corner. He SMASHES RANDY OVER THE HEAD with it. Randy's forehead is BLEEDING. The Ayatollah hits him again, taking dead aim a the forehead cut. MORE BLOOD. Randy crumples to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, alarmed, instinctively goes halfway toward the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah scoops up Randy and BODYSLAMS him. He falls Randy knee-first and starts punching him repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under breath) Wanna take it home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's eyes drift in Cassidy's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: Cassidy is CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it, Randy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy turns back to The Ayatollah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you, bro. Lead the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy flips The Ayatollah over. Randy struggles to his fe He picks up The Ayatollah and levels him with a dropkick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropkick! (a second one) And another! (a third one) And another!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His heart is POUNDING. The fans sense it's near the end. chant rises:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy falls on top of The Ayatollah, putting him in a res move headlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen to this crowd!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah can hear how labored Randy's breathing is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ain't up to it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks around at the crowd, chanting, hungry for the Jam. He looks The Ayatollah in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gets up. He lifts The Ayatollah off the mat, lockin with him chest-to-chest. He arches his back and thrusts h hips. The Ayatollah's feet fly off the canvas as his legs whip into the air. His body does a COMPLETE FLIP as he sl onto his back. Randy stays with him, his body contorting tight BACK FLIP as he CRASHES DOWN on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lateral drop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy gets up. His HEART LURCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers himself back down to his knees. Puts his hand t his chest. Something just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks out at the crowd. The whole place is on its f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy's heart LURCHES AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah sees he's clearly not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pin me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks out at the crowd again. The fans are in a fre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAM JAM! RAM JAM! RAM JAM!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it. Pin me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is torn. He...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy STAGGERS to the corner. His heartbeat is UNNATURAL DEAFENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy can't take any more. She turns and WALKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy plants a foot on the bottom rope. He looks toward Cassidy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: He catches a glimpse of Cassidy disappearing through the curtain into the locker room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks out on the crowd. Chanting, cheering. He star to climb. Standing on the top rope, he looks again at the curtain. She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy exits the arena sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah lies on the ground in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy raises his arms and sticks his elbows out, pressing fists to the sides of his head to form a set of RAM'S HOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, the horns are out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy takes a long look around the auditorium, lingering the fans' faces, savoring their cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He LEAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZE on Randy in mid-air, glorious and immortal.
